articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: The U.S. military will deploy additional fighter jets and Navy warships to the Middle East, the Pentagon said on Friday, as Washington seeks to bolster defenses following threats from Iran and its allies Hamas and Hezbollah.
articles.title: U.S. to send more warships, fighter jets to Middle East to bolster defenses

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin has revoked a plea deal agreed to earlier this week with the man accused of masterminding the Sept. 11 attacks, Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, and two of his accomplices, according to a memorandum signed by Austin on Friday.
articles.title: Pentagon chief revokes plea deal with three Sept. 11 suspects

articles.author: Dmitry Antonov, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: A family of Russian sleeper agents flown to Moscow in the biggest East-West prisoner swap since the Cold War were so deep under cover that their children found out they were Russians only after the flight took off, the Kremlin said on Friday.
articles.title: Children of freed sleeper agents learned they were Russians on the flight, Kremlin says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnamese President To Lam was named general secretary of the Communist Party of Vietnam, the nation's top position, on Saturday, replacing Nguyen Phu Trong, who died two weeks ago.
articles.title: Vietnam President To Lam takes top job as Communist Party chief

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A major Venezuelan opposition movement on Friday said its headquarters had been vandalized amid ongoing tensions over a disputed presidential election, as the country's foreign minister said the U.S. was at the forefront of what the government calls a coup attempt.
articles.title: Venezuelan opposition says headquarters invaded as government alleges coup attempt

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Trevor Hunnicutt, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Kamala Harris is preparing for the fight of her life, if her inner circle is anything to go by.The vice president has surrounded herself with a group of tested operators, many of them Black women who have been involved in Democratic politics for decades.
articles.title: Kamala Harris' inner circle girds for battle

articles.author: Andreas Kranz, Andrey Sychev
articles.description: Russian activists who were released from prison and deported to Germany as part of the biggest prisoner exchange operation since the Cold War said they were certain that one day they would return to their homeland.
articles.title: We'll see our home again, exchanged Russian prisoners say

articles.author: Sachin Ravikumar, Catarina Demony
articles.description: Protesters attacked police and started fires in the northeast English city of Sunderland on Friday as violence spread to another northern city following Monday's killing of three children in Southport.
articles.title: Protests turn violent in Sunderland as UK unrest spreads after Southport killings

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The new acting chief of the U.S. Secret Service said that local police in Pennsylvania should not be held responsible for security failures leading up to the assassination attempt on Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump last month.
articles.title: US Secret Service chief says local police not responsible for Trump shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A separatist group in Indonesia's easternmost region of Papua has agreed to free New Zealand pilot Phillip Mehrtens from more than a year in captivity since kidnapping him, according to an audio message issued by a spokesperson on Saturday.
articles.title: Indonesia's Papua rebels ready to free New Zealand pilot held for over a year
